decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn. It looks to disrupt the opponent's game plan by stealing their creatures with Agent of Treachery, board wiping with Shatter the Sky, and recurring threats with Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck also leverages card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea, while generating evasive threats with Shark Typhoon. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value with its flicker ability. The deck aims to grind out the opponent and outvalue them in the late game.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a large graveyard and utilize Zenith Flare as a finisher. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of small creatures, burn spells, and life gain through cycling. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as an additional source of card advantage and recursion. The deck is designed to be aggressive and proactive, putting pressure on the opponent while also having the ability to quickly recover from setbacks using its cycling cards.

This deck utilizes the Adventure mechanic with the goal of overwhelming the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and spell effects. By generating extra resources and card advantage through Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck aims to control the board and outpace the opponent. Fae of Wishes provides additional utility in pulling specific cards from the sideboard for different situations. Meanwhile, the inclusion of Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast allows for a potentially explosive play by cheating out high-cost creatures like Beanstalk Giant.

The deck focuses on utilizing the adventure mechanic to generate value and tempo on the board. By playing creatures with adventure cards, such as Bonecrusher Giant and Brazen Borrower, the player can maintain board presence while disrupting their opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Lovestruck Beast and Beanstalk Giant to apply pressure on the opponent. Lucky Clover enhances the adventure cards, allowing for multiple triggers. Escape to the Wilds provides card advantage and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast can cheat out powerful creatures. The mana base is built to support all colors necessary for the deck's spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells and board wipes to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional card advantage and value. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while also generating card advantage and card selection with cards like Omen of the Sea and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn, while controlling the opponent's board with cards like Agent of Treachery and Elspeth Conquers Death. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a powerful companion to provide additional value and card advantage. The deck also runs a number of Planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset to generate card advantage and control the opponent's options. Overall, the strategy revolves around establishing control of the game through powerful spells and creatures while maintaining card advantage and board presence.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells in a turn without having to worry about mana limitations. The key strategy is to control the board, steal opponent's creatures with Agent of Treachery, and generate card advantage with Narset and Omen of the Sea. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion for additional value. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells, card draw, and finishers like Shark Typhoon and Elspeth, Sun's Nemesis to maintain board presence and pressure opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with creatures while utilizing sacrifice effects to deal damage and gain advantage. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Gutterbones and Whisper Squad, while also taking advantage of synergy between cards like Mayhem Devil and Witch's Oven. By sacrificing creatures like Serrated Scorpion and Cauldron Familiar, the deck can trigger effects like Judith, the Scourge Diva to deal additional damage and close out the game quickly.

The key concept of this Temur Control deck is to efficiently control the game through using counter spells and removal while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to cast powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides card advantage and life gain while also applying pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and tempo control, with the ability to finish the game with Shark Typhoon tokens or a massive Explosion.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. It aims to stall the game and outvalue the opponent with card advantage engines like Shark Typhoon and Teferi, Time Raveler. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional card advantage and synergy with the deck's abundance of permanents. The deck prioritizes consistency and resilience with a solid mana base and a mix of proactive and reactive spells to handle a variety of threats.

The deck aims to maintain control of the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and enchantments like Elspeth Conquers Death. It also has a strong focus on card advantage and tempo with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Shark Typhoon. The deck is able to generate value and outvalue opponents through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Agent of Treachery. The mana base is designed to support the three-color combination of white, blue, and green, ensuring consistent access to the cards needed to control the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing cycling cards to quickly build up a board presence and deal damage to the opponent. By cycling through cards like Drannith Stinger and Flourishing Fox, the deck can continuously generate value while also potentially drawing into powerful finishers like Zenith Flare. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures and burn spells, taking advantage of the Aggro strategy to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while also generating card advantage with planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The strategy is to survive the early game with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Omen of the Sun, before ramping into big threats like Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for maximum value by blinking permanents and creating overwhelming board presence.

The deck focuses on controlling the board by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. It includes various control cards like Shatter the Sky and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value through blinking permanents. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency in casting spells and utilizing the abilities of different lands.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive gameplay by utilizing cycling cards to draw and play efficiently. It aims to build a board presence with cards like Flourishing Fox and Valiant Rescuer while burning down opponents with cards like Drannith Stinger and Zenith Flare. The deck's synergy allows for consistent card draw, damage output, and creature token generation. The use of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion enhances the deck's overall strategy by allowing for additional card recursion and value generation.

The deck aims to control the game and outvalue opponents with a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Cavalier of Thorns. The deck also focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to cast high-impact spells like Casualties of War. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a powerful companion that allows for extra value by blinking permanents for more card advantage and tempo. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and overwhelm them with powerful late-game plays.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering spells and removing threats. It aims to generate value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wilderness Reclamation, while also maintaining card advantage with draw spells like Opt and Thassa's Intervention. The deck also has a win condition in Shark Typhoon, which can create a large token with its cycling ability. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and outvalue the opponent through powerful spells and efficient card draw. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy, paired with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death, the player aims to stabilize the board and gain card advantage. The deck also has a strong ramp element with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Growth Spiral, allowing the player to quickly get ahead and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy involves generating card advantage and maintaining board presence with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and stay in control of the game until it can win through attrition or stealing key cards with Agent of Treachery.

The deck focuses on generating card advantage and controlling the opponent's board through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. By utilizing Yorion as a companion, the player can benefit from additional value by flickering their permanents. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by consistently drawing cards, ramping with Growth Spiral, and deploying threats such as Uro and Shark Typhoon. With a mixture of control elements and card advantage engines, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize cycling cards to quickly build up a board presence and cycle through the deck to find key cards like Zenith Flare to finish off opponents. Lurrus of the Dream-Den is included as a companion to provide additional value from the graveyard. The deck aims to maintain a fast pace and apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive cycling and efficient combat tricks.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a board presence of small creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards that can cycle for minimal cost, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and finish them off with a powerful Zenith Flare. The main goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent and to be able to adapt to different situations by constantly drawing new cards and cycling through the deck.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Agent of Treachery, Shatter the Sky, and Elspeth Conquers Death, while utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free. The deck also utilizes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By taking advantage of the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad, the deck can generate additional value with enter-the-battlefield effects. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency in casting spells and maintaining control over the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free while controlling the board with cards like Agent of Treachery and Shatter the Sky. The deck aims to generate card advantage and tempo with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also utilizing cards like Shark Typhoon and Elspeth Conquers Death to maintain board presence and deal with threats. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free and control the game. It includes a variety of control cards like Shatter the Sky and Agent of Treachery, as well as planeswalkers like Teferi, Narset, and Lukka to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also incorporates cards like Shark Typhoon for additional value. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the control strategy while ensuring consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on generating value and controlling the game through powerful spells and enchantments. It utilizes Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn, while also taking advantage of cards like Agent of Treachery and Elspeth Conquers Death to control the board. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and flexibility with cards like Omen of the Sea and Shark Typhoon. Combined with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a long game.

The main idea of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful creatures such as Questing Beast, Shifting Ceratops, and Cavalier of Flame to overwhelm the opponent. Fires of Invention allows for explosive plays, while Scorching Dragonfire provides removal options. The inclusion of Gemrazer helps deal with problematic artifacts and enchantments. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain that pressure to close out the game swiftly. The consistency of ramp with Arboreal Grazer and mana fixing with Fabled Passage and Ketria Triome ensures the deck can execute its aggressive game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive strategy using low mana cost creatures and enchantments to quickly build up a powerful board presence. The use of companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in gameplay. By combining efficient removal spells like Dead Weight and Mire's Grasp with powerful buffing enchantments like All That Glitters, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently. The Orzhov color combination allows for a good balance of aggression and control, making it a versatile and competitive deck choice.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain a steady aggressive pace while utilizing sacrifice and steal mechanics to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining powerful creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher and Kroxa with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Claim the Firstborn, the deck aims to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a powerful companion, providing additional value throughout the game. The deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays and resource management to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and sacrificing synergies to deal damage to the opponent quickly and consistently. It includes cards like Cauldron Familiar, Woe Strider, and Mayhem Devil to create a recurring source of damage, while also incorporating cards like Gutterbones and Midnight Reaper for card advantage. The deck also benefits from cards like Witch's Oven and Claim the Firstborn to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a low mana curve and efficient threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and take advantage of sacrificing mechanics to generate value. The combination of sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Serrated Scorpion along with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Witch's Oven allows for consistent damage output and disruption of your opponent's game plan. Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provides additional pressure and disruption, while Claim the Firstborn lets you steal your opponent's creatures to further swing the game in your favor.

Utilizing counter spells and removal to control the game, this deck aims to ramp up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful late-game threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, Brazen Borrower, and Shark Typhoon. It also includes card draw with Thassa's Intervention and Chemister's Insight, while maintaining flexibility with Expansion / Explosion. With a strong mana base and a mix of control elements, this deck provides a versatile and adaptive playstyle to out-maneuver opponents and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various spells and abilities while ramping up mana to play powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and removal spells like Scorching Dragonfire, while also generating card advantage with cards like Growth Spiral and Expansion / Explosion. The inclusion of Wilderness Reclamation allows for explosive turns where multiple spells can be played in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent and securing victory.
